result.execSummary:
The defendant James K Ruley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
----------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James K Ruley in court.  Attorney T. Hilten for  Ashley L Renz in court for James K Ruley.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing - **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James K Ruley not in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for James K Ruley. Requesting 30 days. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James K Ruley not in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for James K Ruley. Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Speedy trial time limits reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. ALL FIREARMS REMOVED FROM HOME PRIOR TO DEFENDANT RETURNING. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH M.C.M.
